The largest jar has a transparent lid, while the other two have opaque ones. The medium sized jar has no rubber gasket on the inside of the lid, so it doesn't close as tightly as the other two lids do. I don't know why Philips didn't include a gasket. Overall It's nice and the black color makes it blend well with my kitchen slab.

Name: Blue Al The Feared
Title: Waste of hard earned money
View1:
To everyone who's thinking to go for grinder please save yourself from the trouble. We have used it for many purpose but it's of no use . First of all, this product is only for dry grinding both small and medium with opaque lid and for wet grinding the biggest jar with transparent lid. Now coming to the actual disadvantages if you're going for it to use for dry grinding let me tell you the blades attached to the product are blunt they will not grind anything and you can clearly see the amount of material you have to use to be able to grind in the jar (capacity) in the shots i have attached , 0.6 litre in jar of 1.5 L (wet), 0.5 L in jar of 1.0 L (dry medium jar) , 0.17L in chutney jar of 0.3L . Now you can decide for yourself is it worth the cost you're paying ? That too on the product which comes with blunt blades ? I tell you what i had in mind when i decided to buy this one , 2 years warranty, brand, if the service center is close to the place i live and 750w power for an easy grind based on visual reviews on social media but they're all fake. Even if it had 1000W power motor i highly doubt it would grind due to quality of blades they ve provided. My bajaj grinder gx4( 500w) grinds better (both wet and dry in same jar ) than this waste. So before going for grinder keep these in mind,
1. Blades if they are strong you won't need a high power motor, even a 500 or 600w motor will do the job if their blades are sharp( make sure its stainless steel not aluminum or material with steel coating)
2. Check if jars provided are for dry or wet grinding or both (in case of attached blades) 3. Capacity how much can u actually use out of the jar.
4. Power 500, 600, 750 watt.
5. Quality of material.
5. Warranty , warranty at last because if you end up with product that doesn't grind what will you do with the warranty ? It will be useless.
Last thing, before buying online make sure the product is returnable, the grinder(kitchen product) comes with 10 days replacement policy and amazon refused to take return according to the policy. Ask your friends, relatives and buy offline because online market is filled with duplicate products especially in this time. Plus this model is already four years old.

PS I haven't attached the product pics as you all already know what it looks like.

Name: Sonal Kamat
Title: Looks great but that's all it is worth!
View1:
A very smart looking product by Philips. I am a long-standing customer of Philips. Whether its the electric razors that the men in the family use or its the juicer or the toaster or the mixer grinder that i use. Before I ordered this mixer in October 2019 I had been using a Philips mixer grinder with a 600 W motor for about 7 -8 years. That mixer was a fairly silent machine and grinding quality (for indian consumption- coconut, dal etc) was very good. I had no complaints with that machine so when I saw this mixer which looking smart and came with a 750 W motor and a reasonable price I immediately bought the machine. I have been using this now for almost 2 years. And here is my experience in the last two years :

In the looks department there is nothing missing. But when it comes to performance I give it a zero. The machine is extremely noisy. The grinding quality is also not great. The masalas and the dry stuff grind well, though it takes a bit longer than my earlier mixers which did not have a motor as strong as this one. The jar also heats up in the process. Grinding Coconut chutney, dosa batter, dal is a big task. End result is not good. There are times when I am grinding something and the mixer runs for quite some time but nothing gets ground. For eg - Coriander chutney. All my other mixers did a very fine job. But in this one I need to repeatedly mix the layer else the top layer of coriander just remains as is. And all this while the motor is busy making a loud grinding noise. The extra power does nothing but add noise. Would recommend the 600 W Simply Silent machine to this one. This one is a definite - NO BUY!
PS. AMAZON PRIME sale is on and I am looking for a mixer within 2 years of buying mine and that's how I came to writing this review today.

To everyone who's thinking to go for grinder please save yourself from the trouble. We have used it for many purpose but it's of no use . First of all, this product is only for dry grinding both small and medium with opaque lid and for wet grinding the biggest jar with transparent lid. Now coming to the actual disadvantages if you're going for it to use for dry grinding let me tell you the blades attached to the product are blunt they will not grind anything and you can clearly see the amount of material you have to use to be able to grind in the jar (capacity) in the shots i have attached , 0.6 litre in jar of 1.5 L (wet), 0.5 L in jar of 1.0 L (dry medium jar) , 0.17L in chutney jar of 0.3L . Now you can decide for yourself is it worth the cost you're paying ? That too on the product which comes with blunt blades ? I tell you what i had in mind when i decided to buy this one , 2 years warranty, brand, if the service center is close to the place i live and 750w power for an easy grind based on visual reviews on social media but they're all fake. Even if it had 1000W power motor i highly doubt it would grind due to quality of blades they ve provided. My bajaj grinder gx4( 500w) grinds better (both wet and dry in same jar ) than this waste. So before going for grinder keep these in mind,
1. Blades if they are strong you won't need a high power motor, even a 500 or 600w motor will do the job if their blades are sharp( make sure its stainless steel not aluminum or material with steel coating)
2. Check if jars provided are for dry or wet grinding or both (in case of attached blades) 3. Capacity how much can u actually use out of the jar.
4. Power 500, 600, 750 watt.
5. Quality of material.
5. Warranty , warranty at last because if you end up with product that doesn't grind what will you do with the warranty ? It will be useless.
Last thing, before buying online make sure the product is returnable, the grinder(kitchen product) comes with 10 days replacement policy and amazon refused to take return according to the policy.
